documents.document: Most great people have attained their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure. ~Napoleon Hill
When an actor plays a scene exactly the way a director orders, it isn’t acting. It’s following instructions. ~James Dean
Life is partly what we make it, and partly what it is made by the friends whom we choose. ~Tehyi Hsieh
Every single day you should wake up and commit yourself to becoming a better person.
A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others. ~Ayn Rand
Sometimes people don’t want to hear the truth because they don’t want their illusions destroyed. ~Friedrich Nietzsche
A positive attitude may not solve all your problems, but it will annoy enough people to make it worth the effort. ~Herm Albright
Even if you’re on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there. ~Will Rogers
It’s never too late - never too late to start over, never too late to be happy. ~Jane Fonda
Before you can win, you have to believe you are worthy. ~Mike Ditka
Most people never run far enough on their first wind to find out they’ve got a second. ~William James
Don’t let someone dim your light simply because it’s shining in their eyes.
It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit. ~Harry S. Truman
No color, no religion, no nationality should come between us, we are all children of God. ~Mother Teresa
Only two ways to live life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle. ~Albert Einstein
True love is like a fine wine, the older the better. ~Fred Jacob
You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world. ~Lucille Ball
There’s a purpose to every failed relationship. The purpose isn’t to encourage you to lower your expectations, but to raise your standards.
Look for something positive in each day, even if some days you have to look a little harder.
Life is what happens to you when you’re busy making other plans. ~John Lennon
You can give without loving, but you can never love without giving. ~Robert Louis Stevenson
Dream as if you’ll live forever, live as if you’ll die today. ~James Dean
The difference between an opportunity and an obstacle is your attitude. Your faith has to be greater than your fear.
Be a good listener. Your ears will never get you in trouble. ~Frank Tyger
When government accepts responsibility for people, then people no longer take responsibility for themselves. ~George Pataki
Judge nothing, you will be happy. Forgive everything, you will be happier. Love everything, you will be happiest.
The real voyage of discovery consists not in making new landscapes but in having new eyes. ~Marcel Proust
The true measure of a man is how he treats someone who can do him absolutely no good. ~Samuel Johnson
Life contains but two tragedies. One is not to get your heart’s desire; the other is to get it. ~Socrates
Whosoever desires constant success must change his conduct with the times. ~Machiavelli
Always remember, others may hate you, but those who hate you don’t win unless you hate the man then you destroy yourself. ~Richard M. Nixon
Happiness is not an accident. Nor is it something you wish for. Happiness is something you design. ~Jim Rohn
I am the master of my fate, I am the captain of my soul. ~William Ernest Henley
When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It’s to enjoy each step along the way. ~Wayne Dyer
It is the nature of the wise to resist pleasures, but the foolish to be a slave to them. ~Epictetus
Don’t regret knowing the people that came into your life. Good people give you happiness. Bad people give you experience.
Knowledge is the beginning of practice; doing is the completion of knowing. ~Wang Yangming
The world can only be grasped by action, not by contemplation. ~Jacob Bronowski
Don’t try to teach a pig to sing; it wastes your time and it irritates the pig. ~Anthony de Mello
Remember, the universe is the echo of our actions and our thoughts. ~Dalai Lama
Storms make oaks take deeper root. ~George Herbert
Sometimes you have to walk away from what you want to find what you deserve.
It requires less character to discover the faults of others, than to tolerate them. ~J. Petit Senn
Successful people are not gifted; they just work hard, then succeed on purpose. ~G.K. Nielson
In the end, we only regret the chances we didn’t take.
You’re never a loser until you quit trying. ~Mike Ditka
For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness. ~Ralph Waldo Emerson
Don’t compare your progress with that of others. We all need our own time to travel our own distance.
If you don’t like something, change it. If you can’t change it, change your attitude. ~Dr. Maya Angelou
In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends. ~Martin Luther King Jr.
Friends are angels who lift our feet when our own wings have trouble remembering how to fly.
Ninety-nine percent of the failures comes from people who have the habit of making excuses. ~George W. Carve
Men are disturbed not by the things that happen, but by their opinion of the things that happen. ~Epictetus
Nobody has everything but everybody has something.
When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It’s to enjoy each step along the way. ~Wayne Dyer #quote
If people judge you for your mistakes, feel sorry for them, for simple minds are usually amused by simple things.
Being a true friend means caring about someone enough to not give up on them even when they have given up on them self.
I never see what has been done; I only see what remains to be done. ~Buddha #quote
If patience is worth anything, it must endure to the end of time. And a living faith will last in the midst of the blackest storm. ~Mahatma Gandhi #quote
The way we communicate with others and with ourselves ultimately determines the quality of our lives. ~Tony Robbins #quote
Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss. ~Ralph Waldo Emerson #quote
The true measure of a man is how he treats someone who can do him absolutely no good. ~Samuel Johnson #quotes
Learn to let go. Not everyone in your life is meant to stay.
Realize that if you have time to whine and complain about something then you have time to do something about it. ~Anthony D’Angelo
Love never fails. Character never quits, and with patience and persistence, dreams do come true. ~Pete Maravich
The fact of the matter is that most actors are shy people. ~Roger Moore
All I ask is the chance to prove that money can’t make me happy. ~Spike Milligan
All I need to make a comedy is a park, a Policeman, and a pretty girl. ~Charlie Chaplin
We are masters of the unsaid words, but slaves of those we let slip out. ~Winston Churchill
All the things I really like to do are either immoral, illegal, or fattening. ~Alexander Woollcott
One who is injured ought not to return the injury, for on no account can it be right to do an injustice. ~Socrates
People learn something every day, and a lot of times it’s that what they learned the day before was wrong. ~Bill Vaughan
Don’t be afraid of losing someone who doesn’t feel lucky to have you.
If someone doesn’t appreciate your presence, make them appreciate your absence.
Kindness is heard by the deaf and is seen by the blind. ~Mark Twain
People are often unreasonable, illogical, and self-centered; Love them anyway. ~Mother Teresa
Patience and perseverance have a magical effect before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish. ~John Quincy Adams
Investing in yourself is the best thing you can do. Anything that improves your own talents; nobody can tax that or take it away from you. ~Warren. Buffett
When you realize your potential to feel good, you will ask no one to be different in order for you to feel good.
Love means to love that which is unloveable. Otherwise it is no virtue at all. ~G. K. Chesterton
I’ve dreamt dreams in my life that have stayed with me ever after. ~Emily Bronte
Life is a cycle, always in motion, if good times have moved on so will times of trouble. ~Indian Proverb
Be good to yourself ‘cause nobody else has the power to make you happy. ~George Michael
The man who moved a mountain is the one who started taking away the small stones. ~Old Chinese Proverb
You block your dream when you allow your fear to grow bigger than your faith. ~Mary Manin Morrissey
The road to success is dotted with many tempting parking spaces. ~Will Rodgers
This is deathless: the liberation of the mind through lack of clinging. ~Buddha
You may not be there yet. But you’re closer than yesterday.
Private victories precede public victories. You can’t invert that process any more than you can harvest a crop before u plant it. ~Stephen Covey
Read a thousand books, and your words will flow like a river. ~Lisa See
You have the temple all inside of you. You just need to reconnect all centers. The last frontier is the inward journey. ~Sonny Brown
People say that you’re going the wrong way when it’s simply a way of your own. ~Angelina Jolie
Life always offers you a second chance. Its called tomorrow.
Most people are afraid of failing and being rejected. Get over these two things, and life is easy. ~Robert Kiyosaki
Concentrate on what will produce results rather than on the results, the process rather than the prize. ~Bill Walsh
If you want to feel rich, just count all the gifts you have that money can’t buy.
All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them. ~Walt Disney
Ask not what your country can do for you; ask what you can do for your country. ~John F. Kennedy
Man can believe the impossible, but can never believe the improbable. ~Oscar Wilde
There are no mistakes in life, just lessons.
